definitions: collective body of people who regularly read particular publication or author
examples: The magazine expanded its readership beyond academic circles
Local newspapers struggle to maintain their readership in digital age

definitions: process of understanding written symbols and extracting meaning from text
particular interpretation or understanding of text, situation, or event
measurement shown by instrument gauge or measuring device
public recitation or performance of written material before audience
examples: Her reading improved dramatically after daily practice sessions
Children develop reading skills at different rates naturally
His reading of the situation proved surprisingly accurate
Different critics offered contrasting readings of the novel
The thermometer reading showed dangerous temperature levels outside
Blood pressure readings were taken every hour
The poetry reading attracted hundreds of literature enthusiasts
She gave a dramatic reading of Shakespeare's sonnets

definitions: act of adapting to changed circumstances or making necessary modifications
examples: The company underwent major readjustment after the merger
Soldiers often face readjustment challenges returning from deployment

definitions: act of admitting someone back into institution or organization previously attended
examples: Hospital readmission rates indicate quality of patient care
The university considered his application for readmission carefully

definitions: visual display of data from electronic device or instrument
process of retrieving and displaying stored information from computer memory
examples: The digital readout showed precise measurements instantly
Engineers studied the readout from the satellite transmission
Computer readout confirmed all systems functioning normally
The sensor readout indicated dangerous radiation levels

definitions: condition of being fully prepared for immediate action or use
examples: The troops stood at the ready for deployment
Keep emergency supplies at the ready during storms

definitions: basic monetary unit of Brazil equal to one hundred centavos
examples: The Brazilian real replaced the cruzeiro in nineteen ninety-four
Exchange rates show one dollar equals five reals

definitions: moment of becoming fully aware or understanding something clearly
process of converting plans or assets into actual results or money
examples: The sudden realisation of her mistake left her speechless
His realisation that time was running out spurred action
Asset realisation helped the company avoid bankruptcy proceedings
The realisation of their dreams took years of effort

definitions: attitude of accepting situations as they actually exist without idealization
artistic movement depicting subjects truthfully without artificiality or supernatural elements
examples: Political realism requires acknowledging uncomfortable truths about power
Her realism about finances prevented overspending on projects
Literary realism emerged as reaction against romantic idealization
The painting exemplified nineteenth century European realism perfectly

definitions: person who accepts and deals with situations as they actually exist
artist or writer who practices realism in their creative work
examples: She's a realist who focuses on achievable goals
Political realists advocate balance of power strategies
The realist painters captured everyday life without romanticization
Nineteenth century realists revolutionized European literature completely

definitions: state of things as they actually exist rather than imagined or idealized
television programming featuring real people in unscripted situations
examples: The harsh reality of poverty affects millions worldwide
Virtual reality technology blurs the line with actual experience
Reality television dominated primetime schedules for years
The reality show followed contestants competing for prizes

definitions: moment of becoming fully aware or understanding something clearly
process of converting plans or assets into actual results or money
examples: The realization hit her suddenly during the meeting
His realization of the danger came too late
Full realization of the project took three years
Asset realization generated necessary operating capital

definitions: process of distributing resources, funds, or responsibilities differently than before
examples: Budget reallocation prioritized education over defense spending
Staff reallocation improved efficiency across all departments

definitions: particular area of activity, interest, or knowledge
kingdom or territory ruled by monarch or sovereign power
examples: Scientific discoveries expanded the realm of human knowledge
This issue falls within the realm of constitutional law
The realm prospered under the wise monarch's rule
Knights defended the realm against foreign invaders

definitions: property consisting of land and buildings legally owned
examples: The realty company specialized in commercial properties downtown
Investment in realty provided steady returns over decades

definitions: standard quantity of paper containing five hundred sheets
very large quantity or amount of something written or printed
examples: The office ordered ten reams of printer paper
A ream contains exactly five hundred sheets
She wrote reams of notes during the lecture
The report contained reams of statistical data

definitions: person who cuts and gathers crops at harvest time
machine designed for cutting and gathering grain crops efficiently
examples: Medieval reapers worked fields with hand scythes
The reaper moved steadily through golden wheat fields
The mechanical reaper revolutionized agricultural productivity dramatically
Modern reapers can harvest hundreds of acres daily

definitions: act of appearing again after absence or period of being hidden
examples: The comet's reappearance occurs every seventy-six years
His sudden reappearance shocked everyone at the reunion

definitions: fresh evaluation or assessment of something previously considered or valued
examples: The property reappraisal showed significant value increase
Historical reappraisal changed perceptions of past events

definitions: back part or area of something, especially building or vehicle
position behind main body of military force or formation
examples: The delivery entrance is located at the rear
Passengers moved toward the rear of the bus
Enemy forces attacked from the rear unexpectedly
Supply lines stretched from headquarters to the rear

definitions: military detachment protecting retreating main force from behind
group defending traditional ideas against progressive change
examples: The rearguard held position while troops retreated safely
Enemy forces overwhelmed the exhausted rearguard unit
Conservative politicians fought a rearguard action against reform
The rearguard of traditional publishing resisted digital transformation

definitions: process of caring for and educating children during development
practice of breeding and raising livestock or other animals
examples: Child rearing practices vary significantly across cultures
Modern rearing emphasizes emotional intelligence development
Cattle rearing provides livelihood for rural communities
Proper rearing ensures healthy livestock production

definitions: process of building up military forces and weapons after disarmament
examples: German rearmament in the thirties violated treaty obligations
The nation's rearmament program modernized outdated equipment

definitions: process of organizing or arranging something in different way or order
examples: Furniture rearrangement transformed the room's appearance completely
The schedule rearrangement accommodated everyone's availability better

definitions: position or direction toward the back or rear of something
examples: The convoy moved rearward to avoid enemy fire
Rearward visibility improved with the new mirror design

definitions: cause, explanation, or justification for action or event
power of mind to think, understand, and form judgments logically
examples: The reason for delay was unexpected weather conditions
She had good reason to question their motives
Human reason distinguishes us from other animals
Pure reason alone cannot solve emotional problems

definitions: person who uses logic and reasoning to solve problems or arguments
examples: She was an excellent reasoner who spotted logical flaws
Abstract reasoners excel at mathematical problem solving

definitions: process of thinking about something in logical way to form conclusions
examples: Her reasoning led to the breakthrough discovery
Faulty reasoning produced incorrect conclusions repeatedly

definitions: process of assessing or evaluating something again with fresh perspective
examples: Tax reassessment increased property values significantly
The situation requires complete reassessment of priorities

definitions: process of assigning someone or something to different position or task
examples: Job reassignment offered fresh career opportunities
The reassignment of resources improved project efficiency

definitions: action of removing doubts or fears by providing comfort and confidence
examples: The doctor's reassurance calmed the anxious patient
Children need constant reassurance during difficult times

definitions: partial return of payment serving as discount or reduction
examples: Manufacturer rebates reduced the car's final price
Energy efficiency rebates encourage green home improvements

definitions: person who resists authority, control, or tradition through opposition
examples: The young rebel challenged outdated social conventions
Armed rebels controlled the northern provinces completely

definitions: armed resistance or uprising against government or established authority
examples: The rebellion spread quickly through rural provinces
Teenage rebellion often involves challenging parental authority

definitions: return to life, activity, or prominence after decline or destruction
examples: The city experienced cultural rebirth after years of decline
Spring symbolizes nature's annual rebirth and renewal

definitions: ball or object bouncing back after hitting hard surface
period of recovery or improvement after setback or decline
examples: He grabbed the rebound and scored immediately
The ball's rebound caught the goalkeeper off guard
Economic rebound followed the recession within months
She dated him on the rebound from her divorce

definitions: television or radio program transmitted again after original broadcast
examples: The documentary rebroadcast reached millions more viewers
Network rebroadcasts filled the summer programming schedule

definitions: process of building something again after damage or destruction
examples: City rebuilding after the earthquake took five years
Team rebuilding focused on developing young talent

definitions: expression of sharp disapproval or criticism of someone's behavior
examples: The judge's rebuke silenced the disruptive attorney
She received a stern rebuke for missing deadlines

definitions: evidence or argument presented to contradict or oppose another argument
examples: The lawyer prepared a detailed rebuttal of accusations
Her rebuttal demolished his carefully constructed argument

definitions: ability to remember information or experiences from the past
official order to return defective product to manufacturer
examples: Her recall of childhood events remained remarkably clear
Total recall of the lecture proved impossible
The automobile recall affected millions of vehicles
Product recall prevented potential consumer injuries

definitions: concise summary of main points or events previously discussed
examples: The news recap highlighted the day's major stories
Let me give you a quick recap of yesterday's meeting

definitions: act of summarizing and restating main points comprehensively
section of musical movement where themes are restated
examples: The final chapter provides recapitulation of key arguments
His recapitulation covered all essential meeting points
The sonata's recapitulation returns to the original key
Musical recapitulation creates structural unity in compositions

definitions: act of capturing again something previously held but lost
examples: The army's recapture of the city boosted morale
Police announced the recapture of escaped prisoners

definitions: process of changing the form, organization, or character of something
examples: The recasting of roles improved the play dramatically
Budget recasting aligned spending with new priorities

definitions: gradual movement away or backward from previous position or state
examples: His receding hairline became more noticeable each year
The receding floodwaters revealed extensive damage below

definitions: written acknowledgment that payment or goods have been received
action of receiving something or fact of its being received
examples: Keep the receipt for warranty claims later
The store emailed a digital receipt immediately
Upon receipt of payment, we'll ship your order
Receipt of the letter confirmed our suspicions

definitions: person who receives or is appointed to receive something
device that receives and converts electronic signals into usable form
player positioned to catch forward passes in American football
examples: The receiver signed for the registered package
Court appointed a receiver to manage bankrupt assets
The radio receiver picked up distant stations clearly
Telephone receivers convert electrical signals to sound
The wide receiver caught seven passes for touchdowns
Star receivers command multimillion dollar contracts

definitions: state of being administered by court-appointed receiver during bankruptcy
examples: The company entered receivership after defaulting on loans
Receivership protected assets while restructuring debts

definitions: container or device designed to receive and hold something specific
examples: Waste receptacles lined the park pathways regularly
The electrical receptacle needed immediate professional replacement
